results.title: Africa untamed
results.brief_description: Documentary examining life and customs in Equatorial Africa. The film follows a boat trip through pygmie country to a pygmie village and shows hunters at work spearing a leopard. The problems of tsi tsi fly and sleeping sickness in big game country are discussed and the behavioural traits of the wild life found in this area, such as giraffes, rhinos and hippos, are examined. Also shows a hunting party in action in elephant country.

results.title: Africa mosaic
results.brief_description: Depicts South Africa as a complex and multi-racial country with a vast diversity of ethnic groups, each with its own language, religion and cultural heritage. Previewing prior to class screening is recommended.

results.title: Africa is my home
results.creator_credit: Atlantis Productions and J. Michael Hagopian
results.brief_description: The life of a Nigerian woman from birth to marriage, as she faces the basic issues of tradition versus progress, Christianity versus Islam, and colonialism versus independence. The strength of family and tribal ties; the happy village life of her childhood; her first awareness of the different religious faiths around her; going to the mission school and being fired by her father’s zeal for independence; growing awareness of political and social problems as she goes to teachers college; her fiance’s graduation from university and his decision to work in the service of his country; their marriage in a Christian church.

results.title: Africa dances
results.creator_credit: George Movshon, Ben Park, United Nations Television and Ramakantha Sarma
results.brief_description: Presents the performance given by Les Ballets Africains in the General Assembly Hall of the United Nations Headquarters on the anniversary of the adoption by the UN of the Human Rights declaration. The vivacity of this authentic dance group is complemented by accompanying instruments. With an introduction by H. E. M. Achkar Marof, ambassador from Guinea to the UN, translated by Alistair Cooke.

results.title: Africa awakens modern Nigeria
results.creator_credit: Atlantis Productions and J. Michael Hagopian
results.brief_description: Presents Nigeria, the most populated country in Africa progressing in the use of modern techniques and self-government. Stresses the influences of climate and geography on the economy, urbanization and education. Shows how the country has developed from a rich and ancient civilization, to becoming an independent nation.

results.title: Afghanistan: threads of life
results.creator_credit: Irwin Dermer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of aspects of the way of life in Afghanistan. Shows the age old methods of making grape juice, rug making, baking, and salt grinding. Also shows the lifestyle of the camel traders and the atmosphere of the bazaars where the rug and carpet makers go to find the best possible price for their wares.

results.title: Afghanistan: the land of crags and deserts
results.brief_description: This film, without narration, includes various aspects of life in Afghanistan. Shows mosques, markets, women in chaderi, camel caravan watering sheep in a desert area, the game of buzkashi a form of polo which uses a headless goat, and examples of weaving and dancing.

results.title: Affordable Housing: Dream or Reality
results.brief_description: With changing lifestyles and the enormous cost of buying a freestanding home, this video looks at basic alternative design elements in housing and town planning to accommodate both aesthetically.

results.title: Aetna: a volcanic eruption on the island of Sicily
results.brief_description: Records, un-narrated, with only a descriptive jazz score, the basic stages of an eruption of Mount Aetna, on the east coast of Sicily. It gives a non-verbal picture of one of the most dramatic of natural events, and is also an indirect portrait of Aetna itself.
